Graphics Designer Job at DM Holdings (DMH)




        
    

        
        DM Holdings (DMH) is a conglomerate of companies with vast interests in Entertainment and Media business. With each of the subsidiaries’ enviable track record, DMH is poised to take a strategic position in providing cutting edge services within the Media/Marketing Communication landscape.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer

Job Location: Ojodu Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	Are you a creative powerhouse with a passion for transforming ideas into eye-catching visuals? A leading Media & Entertainment Company is urgently seeking a talented Graphics Designer to join our team on a full-time, onsite basis.


What We’re Looking For


	First Degree in any discipline (Fine Arts is an added advantage).
	3 - 4 years of proven experience in creative design & conceptualization.
	Proficiency in graphics design tools/software.
	Strong creativity, attention to detail, and ability to work under pressure.
	Candidates must reside within Ikeja, Ogba, Agege, Ojodu Berger, Akute, or nearby areas.


Why Join Us?


	Work in a vibrant media & entertainment environment.
	Opportunity to bring ideas to life for impactful projects.
	Be part of a creative team that values innovation.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@dmholdingslimited.com using “Graphics Designer” as the subject of the mail.

Note: Don’t miss this chance to let your creativity shine!

Finance Officer Job at Pulse Nigeria




        
    

        
        Pulse is Africa’s leading innovative media company, informing and engaging Africa’s young audience - and providing expansive media reach and creative marketing solutions to partners. We run news websites and social channels and marketing and production across Francophone and Anglophone West Africa and East Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Officer

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a Finance Officer to join our vibrant team at Pulse Nigeria.
	In this role, you will be at the heart of our financial operations managing invoices, payments, reconciliations and reporting while working closely with sales and other departments to drive accuracy, compliance and efficiency.
	This is a great opportunity to sharpen your skills, take ownership of key financial processes and make a direct impact on achieving our business goals.


Responsibilities


	Generating, booking and clearing of invoices accurately for customers using the ERP
	Ensure timely and accurate booking and realization of revenues
	Daily posting of transactions into the GL
	Support the management of account receivables
	Handling supplier payments and management of account payables
	Reconciliation of client account statements working closely with the Sales department
	Handling tax reconciliation, payment and filling
	Ensure the correct recording of COGS from all Ad Managers and realize corresponding revenue in real time
	Compute monthly commissions, variable salaries and bonuses for the Sales department and other Executives
	Ensures all invoices, purchase orders, tax certificates, contracts and other relevant documentation are compliant according to local tax regulations and uploaded / referenced in the ERP and Finance Google Drive
	Support with month closing, ensuring Finance department deadlines are met
	Support with sales, finance and business intelligence analysis and reporting
	Work with the Sales and other departments to ensure compliance with business processes
	Support in all efforts for timely funds recovery and to minimise bad debt risk
	Ensure a high-level of accuracy, regulatory compliance, initiative and timeliness in performing all tasks
	Actively identify and propose improved processes that can have a positive impact and help to achieve business goals
	Stay up to date with relevant regulatory guidelines and industry best practice and ensure utmost compliance.
	Support the Sales and Finance department in all activities that can help the company to meet revenue and profit targets
	Maintain strong, trusting relationships with all internal collaborators and external stakeholders
	Perform other duties as may be assigned by your team lead
	Ensure all activities align with the company Code of Conduct.


Requirements


	Must be a graduate of Accounting (B.Sc./HND).
	2 - 3 years of proven experience in accounting operations, preferably within a structured organization.
	Familiarity with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, or any ERP system).
	Must possess advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel
	Strong understanding of financial reporting and general ledger management.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to details.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines effectively.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for working across teams.
	Professional certification or progress towards one (ICAN, ACCA) will be an added advantage.


Benefits


	Flexible Hybrid Work Model
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication Allowance.

Medical Laboratory Technician Job at Krystal Medical Centre




        
    

        
        Krystal Medical Centre is a leading healthcare facility located in Magodo Phase 2, Lagos, Nigeria. Renowned for its commitment to excellence in patient care, the centre offers a comprehensive range of medical services, including general consultations, specialist care, diagnostics, and preventive health services. With a team of experienced professionals and modern medical equipment, Krystal Medical Centre delivers quality, affordable, and accessible healthcare in a serene and secure environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Laboratory Technician

Job Location: Magodo Phase 2, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Description / Responsibilities


	Clean, maintain, and ensure proper functioning of laboratory equipment.
	Collect and analyze body fluids (e.g., blood, urine, spinal fluid).
	Provide technical information and interpretation of test results to physicians, scientists, and researchers.
	Operate, calibrate, and maintain laboratory instruments used in both qualitative and quantitative analyses.
	Ensure a safe and secure environment for patients, staff, and visitors by adhering to established standards, procedures, and legal regulations.
	Maintain patient confidentiality and uphold ethical standards in handling laboratory information.
	Support hospital operations by complying with professional standards, hospital policies, and relevant regulatory requirements.


Qualifications / Experience


	Certified Medical Laboratory Technician from a recognized School of Health Technology, with at least 2 years of hospital-based work experience.
	Strong knowledge and application of Laboratory Quality Management Systems.
	Competence in laboratory data management and basic research literacy.
	Proficiency in performing common medical laboratory tests.
	Must possess a valid Practice License from the relevant regulatory body.
	Computer literacy is required.
	Strong multitasking ability with the capacity to work under pressure and meet deadlines.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their their Applications, including phone number, email address, and copies of credentials to: Krystalmedicalcentre@gmail.com with the Job Position applied for as the subject of the email.
